intro: Cryptandra erubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
